pitrou commented on pull request #3976: ARROW-4862: [C++] Fix gcc warnings in CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3976#discussion_r266888448
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/array/builder_base.h
 ##########
 @@ -170,9 +170,14 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT ArrayBuilder {
     if (new_capacity < 0) {
       return Status::Invalid("Resize capacity must be positive");
     }
+// gcc is aggressively complaining about overflows (due to Resize and
+// GrowByFactor). Overflowing int64_t is an indication of other problems.
 
 Review comment:
   Perhaps not the focus of this PR, but gcc is probably right in this case. Signed overflow is undefined behaviour, so one cannot reliably detect overflows with `new_capacity < old_capacity`. You either have to check beforehand (by doing a subtraction rather than an add) or do the whole resizing computation in unsigned land.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #3976: ARROW-4862: [C++] Fix gcc warnings in CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3976#discussion_r267358659
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/array/builder_base.h
 ##########
 @@ -170,9 +170,14 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT ArrayBuilder {
     if (new_capacity < 0) {
       return Status::Invalid("Resize capacity must be positive");
     }
+// gcc is aggressively complaining about overflows (due to Resize and
+// GrowByFactor). Overflowing int64_t is an indication of other problems.
 
 Review comment:
   I suspect it's code like:
   ```
       auto new_length = length_ + length;
       ARROW_RETURN_NOT_OK(CheckCapacity(new_length, length_));
   ```
   
   Though it's not easy to second-guess the compiler, especially without seeing the actual error message :-)
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #3976: ARROW-4862: [C++] Fix gcc warnings in CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3976#discussion_r267360961
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/array/builder_base.h
 ##########
 @@ -170,9 +170,14 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT ArrayBuilder {
     if (new_capacity < 0) {
       return Status::Invalid("Resize capacity must be positive");
     }
+// gcc is aggressively complaining about overflows (due to Resize and
+// GrowByFactor). Overflowing int64_t is an indication of other problems.
 
 Review comment:
   ```
   In file included from ../src/arrow/array/builder_adaptive.h:22:0,
                    from ../src/arrow/builder.h:22,
                    from ../src/arrow/csv/converter.cc:26:
   ../src/arrow/array/builder_base.h: In member function ‘virtual arrow::Status arrow::csv::{anonymous}::NullConverter::Convert(const arrow::csv::BlockParser&, int32_t, std::shared_ptr<arrow::Array>*)’:
   ../src/arrow/array/builder_base.h:174:5: error: assuming signed overflow does not occur when assuming that (X + c) < X is always false [-Werror=strict-overflow]
        if (new_capacity < old_capacity) {
        ^~
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

pitrou commented on pull request #3976: ARROW-4862: [C++] Fix gcc warnings in CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3976#discussion_r267367758
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/array/builder_base.h
 ##########
 @@ -170,9 +170,14 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT ArrayBuilder {
     if (new_capacity < 0) {
       return Status::Invalid("Resize capacity must be positive");
     }
+// gcc is aggressively complaining about overflows (due to Resize and
+// GrowByFactor). Overflowing int64_t is an indication of other problems.
 
 Review comment:
   I suppose it's:
   ```cpp
       ARROW_RETURN_NOT_OK(CheckCapacity(length_ + 1, length_));
   ```
   in `NullBuilder::AppendNull`.
   
   I suspect that solving this without silencing the warning will involve a fair amount of casting...

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3976#discussion_r267367758
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/array/builder_base.h
 ##########
 @@ -170,9 +170,14 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT ArrayBuilder {
     if (new_capacity < 0) {
       return Status::Invalid("Resize capacity must be positive");
     }
+// gcc is aggressively complaining about overflows (due to Resize and
+// GrowByFactor). Overflowing int64_t is an indication of other problems.
 
 Review comment:
   I suppose it's:
   ```cpp
       ARROW_RETURN_NOT_OK(CheckCapacity(length_ + 1, length_));
   ```
   in `NullBuilder::AppendNull`.
   
   I suspect that solving this without silencing the warning will involve a fair amount of casting from signed to unsigned and backwards.
